Metadata.Title: Compromised Encryption Keys Are Replaced
Metadata.Author: Serge Batchilo, Jason Taylor, Joe Basirico

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 3.6.5.b

What to Check For

There should be a procedure for replacing known or suspected compromised encryption keys.

How to Check

Check the information security policy to make sure that it includes a requirement and a procedure for replacing compromised encryption keys, whether the compromise is known or suspected.

How to Fix

Design a procedure for changing the encryption keys. Document the procedure for changing the keys. Include the requirement and the procedure in the information security policy. Change any known or suspected compromised keys. You may have to add this functionality to your software if you don't have it already.
